sub_title: Global Design Director @IWG | Design Council Expert
summary:
As a seasoned design expert, I create solutions that drive organizational success. With extensive experience in Branding, Retail innovation, Creative Strategy, and Global/Regional team management, I bring a diverse skill set to the table.
My customer-centric mindset and approach enable me to explore new uses, services, and strategic ventures through design. I'm proud to have created unique concepts for Starbucks' retail experience across EMEA, identifying synergies between Retail and Workplace concepts for ING Bank, and developing the future workplace through the lens of Technology and Design at Miro, the leading collaborative digital platform.
I am honored to have received recognition from esteemed institutions, such as the Prince Claus Foundation in the Netherlands, the Centre for Textile Innovation in France, and The Falling Walls Lab in Germany, which acknowledges my professional expertise and impact on the industry and society. My work speaks for itself and demonstrates my ability to deliver exceptional results.

Always up for a challenge, feel to get in touch.

awards.title: President's Award - 2015 Store Design of the Year EMEA
awards.description: President's Award - 2015 Store Design of the Year EMEA - (Collaborator) Highest Honour awarded for design, for a four storey Starbucks store in Kadikoy, Istanbul

awards.title: Special Mention - 2015 Store Design of the Year EMEA
awards.description: Awarded for successful introduction and positioning of Starbucks Reserve® brand,  premium line of specialty coffees.

awards.title: Store Design of the Year 2014 EMEA - High Profile category
awards.description: Highest award for design for the project Mall Of Istanbul in Turkey.

awards.title: Futurotextiles'12 CETI Innovation in textile Award
awards.description: The CETI prize - High Technology in textile innovation awarded to José Subero and Paula Colchero for the project LOOP, an urban seat made from high-performance textile ribbons and stitches.The prize was unanimously awarded by a jury presided by designers Matali Crasset and Fréderic Ruyant in the context of Futurotextiles'12. An international competition aimed to promote textile innovation, the use of new flexible and composite materials and to stimulate connections between designers and the textile industry in the North of France.
awards.issuer: Centre Européen des Textiles Innovants & Lille Design - France

awards.title: CETI High Technology in Textile Innovation prize
awards.description: Professional award CETI High Technology in Textile Innovation prize with LOOP, a suspended seat for public spaces.
awards.issuer: Centre Européen des Textiles Innovants (CETI) and Lille Design

awards.title: A.T. Kerney Scholarship | Falling Walls Lab
awards.description:
The A.T. Kerney scholarship is awarded once a year to young bright minds to participate in the Falling Walls Lab in Berlin. The Falling Walls Lab is a challenging, inspiring and interdisciplinary platform which aims to: 
- support interdisciplinary dialogue and international cooperation
- connect young and senior innovators
- develop new ways of scientific communication 
It offers the opportunity to excellent young academics and professionals to present their outstanding ideas, research projects and initiatives in a short format presentation to an audience of decision makers of enterprises leading in innovation as well as distinguished representatives of scientific institutions.
awards.issuer: A.T. Kerney Global Management Consulting - Germany

awards.title: Artistic Grant | Natureza Urbana: São Paulo
awards.description: The artistic grant program from the Prince Claus Fund supports innovative, high quality cultural initiatives in spaces where resources and opportunities for cultural expression, creative production and research are limited. In this case it was awarded for the project Natureza Urbana, a multi-level initiative that after the 2007 advertisement ban in São Paulo BR, looks to transform through the active involvement of public-private stakeholders, the obsolete billboard structures into supports for hanging gardens in the city.
awards.issuer: Prince Claus Fund for Culture and Development - The Netherlands

awards.title: Infinite Island Exhibition | D'la Mona Plaza
awards.description:
Selected for the exhibition Infinite Island with project D'la Mona Plaza. This exhibition reflected on the Caribbean region's dynamic mix of cultures, diasporas, and socio-political realities. Representing multiple perspectives as it explored complexities of Caribbean history and identity.
Curated by Tumelo Mosaka
awards.issuer: Brooklyn Museum of Art. New York, USA

awards.title: Scholarship for International Post-graduate Studies
awards.description: Scholarship awarded for graduate design studies focusing in Social and Sustainable issues at the Master program Man & Humanity from the Design Academy Eindhoven in the Netherlands.

awards.title: Shortlisted entry professional competition "Modelo Europeo de Ciudad"
awards.description: Collaborator in team of shortlisted entry from DR in the multi-phase international architecture competition "Modelo Europeo de Ciudad" (European City Model) in the context of Compostela 2000. (Santiago de Compostela European Capital of Culture 2000)
awards.issuer: Central Coordination Competition office | Compostela 2000 - Spain-Dom. Republic

certifications.name: Staatsexamen Nederlands als Tweede Taal, Examen II - NT2-II

projects.title: Fysio.com | Physiotherapy practice in Amsterdam Zuid
projects.description: Fysio.com is a young and fresh physiotherapy practice in Amsterdam Zuid. Our work consisted of the concept development of the main identity through mood boards, the creation of a logo, stationery, signage, web design, and advice on the physical space of the practice.

contributors.headline: Global Design Director @IWG | Design Council Expert

projects.title: Natureza Urbana: São Paulo
projects.description: Natureza Urbana is an initiative that, after the 2007 advertisement ban in São Paulo, Brazil- uses billboard structures as supports for aerial gardens that showcase local flora and fauna in the middle of the city. Aiming to transform an array of former advertisement structures into a network of ecological hotspots. Promoting the investing companies through Natureza Urbana online platforms that connect them with the image of the green billboard. Therefore presenting a unique experience for local residents and an urban model of international reach. This project was awarded an artistic grant from the prestigious Prince Claus Foundation in the Netherlands.

contributors.headline: Global Design Director @IWG | Design Council Expert

projects.title: The Knot | Milano mi fa Male
projects.description: As part of Milano's conceptual map, the proposal looks to place a strange object on top of the 'Tangenziale Est' giving character to the anonymous site and becoming a visual reference to people in transit. The concept was exhibited in the NABA school in Milano and presented during Salone del Mobile 2007.

contributors.headline: Global Design Director @IWG | Design Council Expert

projects.title: What do you keep in your roof?
projects.description: Part of the initiative 'Arte Urbano Sarmiento' this project tries to shift the look towards the cluttered rooftops of the city of Santo Domingo as one connected fantastic landscape of different densities and full of objects. This project was exhibited on billboards around the city as part of the urban art exhibition 'City Conscience' to raise awareness of the social, cultural, and economic aspects of the city.

contributors.headline: Global Design Director @IWG | Design Council Expert

projects.title: D'la Mona Plaza: "The waters stop here"
projects.description: A socio-cultural artistic project that explores the tension caused by illegal journeys by boat between the Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico. The project proposes a rest stop in the middle of the Mona Channel for travelers from both countries. A neutral zone where different social groups traveling for different reasons meet without distinction. This was done in collaboration with art collective SHAMPOO (Maurice Sánchez, Angel Rosario, Miguel Canaán) and architects Gustavo Moré, Eduardo Veras and Jorge Santiago for the 3rd Polygraphic Triennial in Puerto Rico

contributors.headline: Global Design Director @IWG | Design Council Expert

projects.title: Ruilbank Amsterdam
projects.description:
Ruilbank [exchange bench in dutch] is a design/artistic installation that uses Amsterdam typical wooden benches to promote reading and social interaction in public space.

A metal clip is placed on benches throughout the city and reading material is placed daily on them to encourage people to take, read and share.

contributors.headline: Global Design Director @IWG | Design Council Expert

projects.title: Loop | urban textile seat
projects.description:
Prototype development of textile urban furniture commissioned by Centre Européen des Textiles Innovants (CETI) and Lille Design after being awarded the highest prize in Futurotextiles’12 competition. This was done in collaboration with designer P. Colchero (Pivot) and several textile companies from the region Nord-pas-de Calais, France. I was involved in all phases: concept development, material research, elaboration of working prototypes, compiling data to draft technical drawings, specifications, and cost estimates.
Production:
Lambin-Ravau (Manufacturer of lifting and securing straps)
Fablab Amsterdam

contributors.headline: Global Design Director @IWG | Design Council Expert

projects.title: MINI Design rides Waiting Spot
projects.description: The MINI design rides Waiting Spot is a public space installation meant to create a visible spot for both the taxi service by MINI transporting people in between exhibitions in the Dutch Design Week and the users to recognize the spot where they should wait. It was created in collaboration with MINI, using their logo to make tracks that show the path of the cars, creating brand recognition through an artistic signage solution.

profile_positions.description: Contributing to Design Council’s thought leadership role, sharing knowledge, and learning from other experts within the network in a community of practice.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for strategic advice on workplace and new retail banking concepts globally.
This includes: 
-Managing relationships with nine countries. 
-Driving development and safeguarding of Global Guidelines and Implementation Framework, 
-Reviewing RE portfolio and investment plans.
-Providing mentorship and support to local internal/external teams.

profile_positions.title: Senior Designer - International Store Design & Concepts EMEA

profile_positions.description:
Region: Spain, Portugal, Greece, Cyprus
Responsible for providing design direction to both internal and external designers. 
Overseeing effective planning and delivery of pre-design and design phases. Portfolio review, scoping visits, and refurbishment plan of several stores across Spain, including major cities such as Barcelona and Madrid.
Worked collaboratively with both internal design team and license construction teams on delivering projects with the required cultural sensitivity and technical excellence following heritage sites in Spain and Portugal.
Key projects
Casa Miranda, Puerto de la Cruz - Canary Islands: Starbucks store in one of the few remaining original Canary architecture heritage sites.
Toledo, SP - First store in the city, listed site.
Granada SP - First store in the city, the launch of the new submarket.
Braga, Portugal - First store in the city, the launch of the new submarket.
Athens, Greece - Initial phase of refurbishment for a store in Athens's historical center, Plaka.

profile_positions.title: Independent design professional

profile_positions.description:
Project lead of a self-initiated public space project that after the removal of advertisement after The Clean City Law (2007) looks to re-purpose existing billboard structures into ecological hotspots. Leveraging financial and promotional support from companies that used to advertise in these structures, creating a new cooperative public-private relationship.
This was supported by the Prince Claus Foundation, in collaboration with Bijarí, an award-winning art & design collective based in São Paulo. I was responsible for the strategy development and operational plans connected to three major stakeholders in the project: local government, consumer brands, general public. Other responsibilities included roadmap planning, detailed architectural drawings, as well as providing overall creative direction to other team members.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead - Natureza Urbana

profile_positions.title: Architect

volunteer_experiences.description: Brainstorming sessions, discussion on several startup ideas and initiatives. Initial meetings for the Amsterdam chapter.

Exhibition and a series of conferences revolving around topics of identity, nationality, citizenship, and social cohesion in the Netherlands. My duties consisted of providing assistance to a varied group of international artists on practical organizational aspects and in cases a translator from Spanish to English. It was an interesting opportunity to get acquainted with identity issues in the Netherlands, to see the different artistic responses to these topics, and to expand my professional network.

Assistant of Enrique Garcia Formentí lead architect of the team from Mexico for the project “Urban Ideas for Santo Domingo 2002” My role was of local counterpart assisting with practical duties such as transport and communication, and providing insight on the previously assigned work sites. Great experience working with international teams over tight deadlines resulting in the improvement of my organizational and communication skills while expanding my international network.

company.name: Santo Domingo City Hall - CONAU, D.R.

volunteer_experiences.description: Seminar “Opportunities and Potentials of Caribbean Cities Waterfronts” an interdisciplinary encounter in the context of the "Santiago de Compostela European Capital of Culture 2000" with the aim to analyze and share experiences of managing marine fronts in the Caribbean and discuss the potential and opportunities offered by these sites in order to achieve better spaces for better cities.
